title: Song of the Clyde
brief_description: A study of the Clyde River, from its source at Elvanfoot to its mouth a Glasgow. This ships built on Clydesdale are famous throughout the world. The film shows the docks, shipyards, and wharves which line the Clyde as it enters the sea. Written by Harold Purcell. Music composed by George Posford, arranged and conducted by Peter Yorke.
